title: Internet exploder 9
body: code fixes for ie9, and some icon and build changes

title: Update README.md
body: Moving some docs to the website.

title: Node sdk enhancements
body: A series of SDK fixes and enhancements based on experiences using the SDK in the Phrixus project

title: Fix for build breakage caused by RAT
body:
RAT was breaking my build because I have some Netbeans project files around so I added some exclusions. Also added an exclusion for a tmp directory that was causing RAT to fail.

Also: moved SimpleService to the new package naming scheme.

title: Adding licence headers
body:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/USERGRID-4

I'm adding license headers of files (java, xml, properties, etc). Also adding apache-rat maven plugin.
Overall review, please. However, we have to avoid license conflict in Inflector class ( remove or replace something )
https://github.com/usergrid/usergrid/blob/master/stack/core/src/main/java/org/apache/usergrid/utils/Inflector.java

title: Client local repo
body:
Add old Usergrid Java SDK client in a local Maven repo because our old repo (https://usergrid-maven.s3.amazonaws.com/dependencies) has gone away.

We can't use the newest Java SDK because it depends on the newest Jackson (2.3.1) and we cannot just drop it into the REST tests as it is a big API change. We REALLY need to upgrade the REST tests to use newer Jackson & Jersey, but that is a huge undertaking, so far now we have a temporary local repo.

title: Add old Usergrid Java SDK client in a local Maven repo
body:
...because our old repo (https://usergrid-maven.s3.amazonaws.com/dependencies) has gone away.

We can't use the newest Java SDK because it depends on the newest Jackson (2.3.1) and we cannot just drop it into the REST tests as it is a big API change. We REALLY need to upgrade the REST tests to use newer Jackson & Jersey, but that is a huge undertaking, so far now we have a temporary local repo.

title: Improve output of OrganizationExport module
body:
This change exports additional columns that may be useful for OrganizationExport workflows, including UUIDs and statuses.

It also outputs dates in epoch instead of formatted UTC for better machine readability.

title: Unique properties
body:
This pull request implements unique value verification for the new "Core Persistence" module.

**Unique Values verification**

Implemented in the Collection Module, in the mvcc.stage.write package

**How we do it.**

At the write-unique-verify stage we look at the entity to be stored. We loop through each field and if the field is marked as a unique field and we attempt to write row and a column in the Unique Values Column Family (CF).

```
   Unique Values CF

   Row-key is composite: Collection Scope + Field name + Field value
   Column name is composite: Entity ID + Entity Version 
```

When we write we use a TTL value so our row and column will only live for a couple of seconds.

After we write that row and column we load it back and if what we load does not match what we wrote then our value was not unique, and we throw a duplicate value exception. If there is no duplicate value then we go ahead to the write commit stage and we re-write all of the unique values we stored before, but this time with no TTL because they are final.

**Here are the key interfaces and classes:**

```
UniqueValue: object that gets stored in the Unique Values column family
UniqueValueImpl

EntityVersion: entity ID and version, serves as Column Name in Unique Values CF 
EntityVersionSerializer
EntityVersionSerializerTest

FieldSerializer: serializes a Field, only works for primative types (for now)
FieldSerializerTest

UniqueValueSerializationStrategy: writes and loads UniqueValues in Cassandra
UniqueValueSerializationStrategyImpl
UniqueValueSerializationStrategyImplTest

WriteCommit: re-writes any unique values with with no TTL 

WriteUniqueVerify: checks for duplicates by writing and reading from Unique Values CF
```

title: Usergrid 2855 pagingtesting
body:
Fixes an issue with retaining a cursor on an exhausted iterator for future calls.

USERGRID-2862

title: Functional performance testing harness for 2.0
body:
This is a functional version of the performance testing harness to be used for 2.0. Changes include:

o Updates to Archaius Dependencies
o Removed coupling between standard Blitz4J logging being use to log results
- was nice thanks to asynchronous writes for free
- was complicating the proper setup of appending file loggers in log4j
  o Added Amazon S3 based registration of clients
  o Removed hack for @Log tag which was causing several issues not to mention improper scope classifiers
  o New ResultsLog class that asynchronously logs to a file from a buffer

title: Wrapping up and adding S3 functionality
body:
This is a functional version of the performance testing harness to be used for 2.0. Changes include:

   o Updates to Archaius Dependencies
   o Removed coupling between standard Blitz4J logging being use to log results
        - was nice thanks to asynchronous writes for free
        - was complicating the proper setup of appending file loggers in log4j
   o Added Amazon S3 based registration of clients
   o Removed hack for @Log tag which was causing several issues not to mention improper scope classifiers
   o New ResultsLog class that asynchronously logs to a file from a buffer
